content.description:
POPULATION PYRAMID

The population pyramid shown represents a community that has been affected by human migration.
content.question:
A. Explain ONE social reason why people under the age of 50 are unlikely to migrate to this community.

B. Describe ONE economic pull factor that would draw migrants from long distances to the location shown in the pyramid.

C. Explain ONE reason why the male population aged 65 and over can be significantly smaller than the female population over age 65.

D. Explain the degree to which the population pyramid shown can be used to predict local needs for food services.

frqParts.text:

B. Describe ONE economic pull factor that would draw migrants from long distances to the location shown in the pyramid.

C. Explain ONE reason why the male population aged 65 and over can be significantly smaller than the female population over age 65.

D. Explain the degree to which the population pyramid shown can be used to predict local needs for food services.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain patterns and trends in maps and in quantitative and geospatial data to draw conclusions.
